Platform.Title: UBEC Array3
Platform.Manufacturer: UBEC, School of Biosciences, University of Birmingham, Birmingham, UK
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: The 70-mer oligonucleotide array was constructed, containing 6112 oligonucleotides that sampled chromosomal genes identified in the genome sequences of E. coli strains K-12 MG1655, O157:H7 VT2 Sakai, and O157:H7 EDL933 and plasmid genes from the two genome-sequenced O157:H7 strains (the Operon Array Ready E. coli Oligonucleotide™ set 1.0, Qiagen- Operon, Hilden, Germany). 12 positive and 12 negative control oligonucleotides were also included. The oligonucleotides were resuspended in Corning Pronto! buffer and printed on to Corning UltraGAPS™ slides (Corning B.V Life Sciences, Schiphol-Rijk, Netherlands ) using a Biorobotics Microgrid TAS array printer. Amersham Lucidea Universal Scorecard™ controls (GE Healthcare, Little Chalfont, UK) were printed in each subarray. Slides were desiccated under vacuum for 48 hours and then U.V. cross-linked with a dose of 600mJ using a Stratalinker (Stratagene limited, U.K.). Slides were stored under desiccating conditions in the dark until use

Column.Name: MG1655 K12 Map
Column.Description: E.coli K12 MG1655 chromosome gene coordinates

Column.Name: MG1655 K12 DBid
Column.Description: E.coli K12 MG1655 database ID information

Column.Name: MG1655 K12 Product
Column.Description: E.coli K12 MG1655 gene product description

Column.Name: O157 EDL933 Map
Column.Description: E.coli O157 EDL 933 chromosome gene coordinates

Column.Name: O157 EDL933 DBid
Column.Description: E.coli O157 EDL 933 database ID information

Column.Name: O157 EDL933 Product
Column.Description: E.coli O157 EDL 933 gene product description

Column.Name: O157 Sakai Map
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai chromosome gene coordinates

Column.Name: O157 Sakai DBid
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai database ID information

Column.Name: O157 Sakai Product
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai gene product description

Column.Name: pO157 ORF Name
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai pO157 ORF name

Column.Name: pO157 Gene Symbol
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai pO157 gene name

Column.Name: pO157 Map
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai pO157 chromosome gene coordinates

Column.Name: pO157 DBid
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai pO157 database ID information

Column.Name: pO157 Product
Column.Description: E.coli O157 Sakai pO157 gene product description

Sample.Title: ME0052

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 MEM-HEPES + 20uM ME0052 (in DMSO)
Channel.Characteristics: MEM-HEPES supplemented with 0.1% Glucose and 250nM Fe(NO3)2
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 was grown in the presence of 20uM ME0052
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 was grown at 37 degrees C to OD 0.7 in MEM-HEPES supplemented with 0.1% Glucose and 250nM Fe(NO3)2.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An RNeasy minikit was used to prepare total RNA according to the manufacturer’s instructions (QIAGEN Ltd.). Any contaminating DNA was removed using a DNAase column kit (QIAGEN Ltd).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 20 ug total RNA was converted to Cy3-labelled cDNA using the CyScribe Post-Labelling Kit (Amersham Biosciences/GE Healthcare) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Amino-allyllabelled nucleotides were incorporated into the cDNA by reverse transcription of the total RNA, followed by a direct chemical coupling of Cy3 NHS-dye esters to the amino-allyl-labelled cDNAs.

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 MEM-HEPES + DMSO
Channel.Characteristics: MEM-HEPES supplemented with 0.1% Glucose and 250nM Fe(NO3)2
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 was grown in the presence of DMSO
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 was grown at 37 degrees C to OD 0.7 in MEM-HEPES supplemented with 0.1% Glucose and 250nM Fe(NO3)2 and and equivalent volume of DMSO.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An RNeasy minikit was used to prepare total RNA according to the manufacturer’s instructions (QIAGEN Ltd.). Any contaminating DNA was removed using a DNAase column kit (QIAGEN Ltd).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 20 ug total RNA was converted to Cy3-labelled cDNA using the CyScribe Post-Labelling Kit (Amersham Biosciences/GE Healthcare) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Amino-allyllabelled nucleotides were incorporated into the cDNA by reverse transcription of the total RNA, followed by a direct chemical coupling of Cy3 NHS-dye esters to the amino-allyl-labelled cDNAs.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prior to hybridization, the slides were treated with the background-reducing Pronto! Pre-Soak System (Corning Life Sciences). The slides were incubated for 20 min in prewarmed Universal Pre-Soak solution at 42 °C and washed twice in 0.1_SSC, 0.1% SDS for 30 s at room temperature. Slides were immediately transferred into prewarmed prehybridization solution (5_ SSC, 0.1% SDS, and 0.1% bovine serum albumin) and incubated for 2–4 h at 42 °C. The microarray slides were finally washed at room temperature once in 0.1_ SSC, 0.1% SDS for 1 min and twice in 0.1_ SSC for 30 s, briefly dipped in water and then ethanol, and dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 800_g. For each experiment, equal quantities (80 pmol) of each Cy5- and Cy3-labeled cDNA were added to a final volume of 80 _l of hybridization solution containing 25% formamide, 10 mg of bovine serum albumin (fraction V) per ml, 5_ SSC (1_ SSC is 0.15 M NaCl, 0.015 M sodium citrate), 0.1% SDS, 8 _g of poly(A), and 1_Denhardt’s solution. The cDNA probes were denatured at 95 °C for 3 min and hybridized for 16 h at 42 °C. After hybridization was complete, the slides were washed in 2_SSC, 0.1% SDS at 42 °C for 2 min in 0.1_SSC, 0.1% SDS for 2 min at room temperature, and finally twice in 0.1_ SSC for 2 min at room temperature. The microarray slides were dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 800g.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slide was scanned at 532 and 630 nm by using a Genepix 4000A scanner (Axon Instruments, Union City, CA).
Sample.Description: Recent small molecule inhibitors have been shown to down regulate trascription of TTS in enterohaemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC). E. coli O157 strain TUV93-0 has been shown to induce Type III secretion (TTS) in MEM-HEPES media. Transcriptional profiling of E.coli TUV93-0 was carried out in MEM-HEPES the prescence and absence of small molecule inhibitors to establish the global effects of these inhibitors in EHEC.
Sample.Data-Processing: LOWESS normalised data that represents the average of the three replicate experiments

Series.Title: Transcriptional response of Escherichia coli O157 TUV93-0 to small molecule inhibitors of TTS
Series.Summary: The transcriptional profile of Escherichia coli O157 treated with small molecule inhibitors of type III secretion was determined. Four variations of the small molecule inhibitor were assessed for global changes in transcription by treating cells with 20uM of inhibitor or an equivalent volume of DMSO (inhibitor solvent). Keywords: treatment, dose, Cy3, Cy5, 2-colour
Series.Overall-Design: For each inhibitor, biological tripicates of treated (20uM inhibitor in DMSO) and untreated (DMSO only) cultures were grown in 25ml of MEM-HEPES supplemented with 0.1% Glucose and 250nM Fe(NO3)2. RNA was extracted from 15ml of culture at OD 0.7 and labeled with Cy5 (treated) and Cy3 (untreated) (excepting ME0055 that was performed as a dye swap). Labeled untreated RNA was pooled prior to hybridisation. Treated RNA (biological replicates) and pooled untreated RNA was hybridised to microarray slides. Slides were scanned using an Axon 4100A scanner and data processed using Genespring GX.
